qas.question: What percentage of the Swazi population are Christian?
Which religious belief is most prevelant in Swaziland?
What amount of Swazi Christians are Roman Catholic?
Who is the Anglican Bishop of Swaziland?
How many Jewish families are there in Swaziland?
What country makes up 83% of Africa's Christians?

plausible_answers.text: Anglican, Protestant and indigenous African churches

qas.question: What protestant denominations make up 20% of the population?
What Catholic Rite  makes up 40% of the population?
How many Hindu families are there?

context: <a0_0>83%<a0_0/> of the total population adheres to <a1_0>Christianity<a1_0/>, making it the most common religion in <b5_0>Swaziland<b5_0/>. <b6_0>Anglican, Protestant and indigenous African churches<b6_0/>, including African Zionist, constitute the majority of the Christians (40%), followed by <b7_0>Roman Catholicism<b7_0/> at <a2_0>20%<a2_0/> of the population. On 18 July 2012, <a3_0>Ellinah Wamukoya<a3_0/>, was elected Anglican Bishop of Swaziland, becoming the first woman to be a bishop in Africa. 15% of the population follows traditional religions; other non-Christian religions practised in the country include Islam (1%), the Bahá'í Faith (0.5%), and Hinduism (0.2%). There are <a4_0><b8_0>14<b8_0/><a4_0/> Jewish families.
